bibl.title: Francis Stephan Medcraf vs. Robert T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF the application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus 3038 Petition for Appeal

THE ABOVE NAMED PETITIONER, conceiving himself aggrieved by the decision, order and judgment made and entered in the above entitled cause on the 30th day of September A. D. 1915, wherein and whereby it was considered, ordered and adjudged that the Writ of Habeas Corpus prayed for herein be denied and the petitioner remanded to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washington, and that the statute of the State of Washington set forth and complained of in the petition herein was and is valid and not in conflict with the provisions of Article XIV of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, and was and is not in conflict with the provisions of Article V of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, does her eby APPEAL from the said order, decision and judgmentand from the whole thereof, to the SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES , for the reasons specified in the Assignment of Errors filled herewith in this cause, and prays that this appeal may be allowed, and that a transcript of the record, papers and proceedings upon which said judgment, findings and order was made and entered, duly authenticated, may be sent to the Supreme Court of the United States.
Dated September 30th A.D. 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Attorney for Petitioner 419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
div1.p: The foregoing petition on appeal is granted, and the claim of appeal therein made is allowed.
Done in open Court, this 30th day of September A.D. 1915.
div1.ab: Jeremiah Neterer District Judge and the Presiding Judge before whom said cause was heard.
div1.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING SS
FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF being first duly sworn says;
That he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition for appeal That he knows the contents of said petition and verily believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and s worn to before me this 30th day of September A.D. 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Notary Piblic for Washington Residing at Seattle.
div1.p: ORIGINAL No.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
Service of within petition this 30th day of Sept 1915 and receipt of a copy thereof, admitted,
div1.ab: Frank P Helsell Attorneys for Resp.
div1.p: In Re application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition for Appeal
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION SEP301915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Appellant
Telephone: Elliott 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS"
